tool_input.command:
gh pr create --title "feat(render): make map text selectable" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Region labels and file names in the map overlay now have `pointer-events: auto` and `cursor: text`, making them click-selectable/copyable in the browser
- Camera pan still works from any empty canvas area; zoom (scroll wheel) is preserved by extracting `Camera.onWheel()` and forwarding overlay wheel events to it
- Applied changes to both the `.ts` sources and their pre-compiled `.js` counterparts (Vite resolves explicit `.js` imports to the literal `.js` files at runtime)

## Changes

- `render/src/renderer/MapOverlay.ts` / `.js` — add `pointer-events:auto;cursor:text` to label and file-list elements
- `render/src/core/Camera.ts` / `.js` — extract wheel handler into public `onWheel(e)` method
- `render/src/main.ts` — forward `overlayContainer` wheel events to `camera.onWheel()` so zoom works when hovering over text
- `render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — Puppeteer smoke test: spins up the fixture server, loads the page, selects a label via the Selection API, and asserts non-empty text is returned

## Test plan

- [x] Automated smoke test passes: `node render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — 15 selectable elements found, `"root"` selected successfully
- [x] Screenshot confirms blue selection highlight on map label
- [ ] Manual: open the render page, click-drag over a region name or file name to select and copy it
- [ ] Manual: verify camera pan still works by dragging from an empty map area
- [ ] Manual: verify scroll-to-zoom still works when hovering over a text label

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

- Camera pan still works from any empty canvas area; zoom (scroll wheel) is preserved by extracting `Camera.onWheel()` and forwarding overlay wheel events to it
- Applied changes to both the `.ts` sources and their pre-compiled `.js` counterparts (Vite resolves explicit `.js` imports to the literal `.js` files at runtime)

## Changes

- `render/src/renderer/MapOverlay.ts` / `.js` — add `pointer-events:auto;cursor:text` to label and file-list elements
- `render/src/core/Camera.ts` / `.js` — extract wheel handler into public `onWheel(e)` method
- `render/src/main.ts` — forward `overlayContainer` wheel events to `camera.onWheel()` so zoom works when hovering over text
- `render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — Puppeteer smoke test: spins up the fixture server, loads the page, selects a label via the Selection API, and asserts non-empty text is returned

## Test plan

- [x] Automated smoke test passes: `node render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — 15 selectable elements found, `"root"` selected successfully
- [x] Screenshot confirms blue selection highlight on map label
- [ ] Manual: open the render page, click-drag over a region name or file name to select and copy it
- [ ] Manual: verify camera pan still works by dragging from an empty map area
- [ ] Manual: verify scroll-to-zoom still works when hovering over a text label

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

Bash → gh pr create --title "feat(render): make map text selectable" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Region labels and file names in the map overlay now have `pointer-events: auto` and `cursor: text`, making them click-selectable/copyable in the browser
- Camera pan still works from any empty canvas area; zoom (scroll wheel) is preserved by extracting `Camera.onWheel()` and forwarding overlay wheel events to it
- Applied changes to both the `.ts` sources and their pre-compiled `.js` counterparts (Vite resolves explicit `.js` imports to the literal `.js` files at runtime)

## Changes

- `render/src/renderer/MapOverlay.ts` / `.js` — add `pointer-events:auto;cursor:text` to label and file-list elements
- `render/src/core/Camera.ts` / `.js` — extract wheel handler into public `onWheel(e)` method
- `render/src/main.ts` — forward `overlayContainer` wheel events to `camera.onWheel()` so zoom works when hovering over text
- `render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — Puppeteer smoke test: spins up the fixture server, loads the page, selects a label via the Selection API, and asserts non-empty text is returned

## Test plan

- [x] Automated smoke test passes: `node render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — 15 selectable elements found, `"root"` selected successfully
- [x] Screenshot confirms blue selection highlight on map label
- [ ] Manual: open the render page, click-drag over a region name or file name to select and copy it
- [ ] Manual: verify camera pan still works by dragging from an empty map area
- [ ] Manual: verify scroll-to-zoom still works when hovering over a text label

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

payload.last_assistant_message:
The GitHub API doesn't expose app management via `gh` CLI — you'll need to remove it through the GitHub web UI. Here's exactly where to go:

1. Go to **https://github.com/settings/installations** (your personal GitHub settings → Integrations → Applications)
2. Find **chatgpt-codex-connector** (or similar name — that's the bot leaving the reviews)
3. Click **Configure** → scroll down to **Repository access** → remove `cli-rts` from the list, or click **Uninstall** to remove it entirely

Alternatively, if it was installed at the org/repo level:
- **https://github.com/PureSin/cli-rts/settings/installations**

The bot user in the PR comments is `chatgpt-codex-connector[bot]`, so that's the app to look for.

Bash → gh pr create --title "feat(render): make map text selectable" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Region labels and file names in the map overlay now have `pointer-events: auto` and `cursor: text`, making them click-selectable/copyable in the browser
- Camera pan still works from any empty canvas area; zoom (scroll wheel) is preserved by extracting `Camera.onWheel()` and forwarding overlay wheel events to it
- Applied changes to both the `.ts` sources and their pre-compiled `.js` counterparts (Vite resolves explicit `.js` imports to the literal `.js` files at runtime)

## Changes

- `render/src/renderer/MapOverlay.ts` / `.js` — add `pointer-events:auto;cursor:text` to label and file-list elements
- `render/src/core/Camera.ts` / `.js` — extract wheel handler into public `onWheel(e)` method
- `render/src/main.ts` — forward `overlayContainer` wheel events to `camera.onWheel()` so zoom works when hovering over text
- `render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — Puppeteer smoke test: spins up the fixture server, loads the page, selects a label via the Selection API, and asserts non-empty text is returned

## Test plan

- [x] Automated smoke test passes: `node render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — 15 selectable elements found, `"root"` selected successfully
- [x] Screenshot confirms blue selection highlight on map label
- [ ] Manual: open the render page, click-drag over a region name or file name to select and copy it
- [ ] Manual: verify camera pan still works by dragging from an empty map area
- [ ] Manual: verify scroll-to-zoom still works when hovering over a text label

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

file.content:
#!/usr/bin/env bash
# cli-rts SessionStart hook
# Ensures capture daemon and render server are running, opens browser tabs,
# then forwards the session-start event payload to the daemon.

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
CLI_RTS_ROOT="$(dirname "$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")")"  # bin/ -> capture/ -> cli-rts/
CAPTURE_JS="$CLI_RTS_ROOT/capture/dist/cli.js"
RENDER_DIR="$CLI_RTS_ROOT/render"

STARTED=false

# 1. Start capture daemon if not already running on port 4175
if ! lsof -ti:4175 > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  (cd "$CLI_RTS_ROOT" && node "$CAPTURE_JS" start > /dev/null 2>&1) &
  STARTED=true
fi

# 2. Start render server if not already running on port 5175
if ! lsof -ti:5175 > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  (cd "$RENDER_DIR" && npm run dev > /dev/null 2>&1) &
  STARTED=true
fi

# Give freshly-started servers a moment to bind
if [ "$STARTED" = true ]; then
  sleep 2
fi

# 3. Open browser tabs
if command -v open > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  # macOS
  open "http://localhost:5175" 2>/dev/null
  open "http://127.0.0.1:4175/state" 2>/dev/null
elif command -v xdg-open > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  # Linux
  xdg-open "http://localhost:5175" 2>/dev/null
  xdg-open "http://127.0.0.1:4175/state" 2>/dev/null
fi

# 4. Forward the session-start event payload (stdin from hook) to the daemon
node "$CAPTURE_JS" emit session-start

Bash → gh pr create --title "feat(render): make map text selectable" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Region labels and file names in the map overlay now have `pointer-events: auto` and `cursor: text`, making them click-selectable/copyable in the browser
- Camera pan still works from any empty canvas area; zoom (scroll wheel) is preserved by extracting `Camera.onWheel()` and forwarding overlay wheel events to it
- Applied changes to both the `.ts` sources and their pre-compiled `.js` counterparts (Vite resolves explicit `.js` imports to the literal `.js` files at runtime)

## Changes

- `render/src/renderer/MapOverlay.ts` / `.js` — add `pointer-events:auto;cursor:text` to label and file-list elements
- `render/src/core/Camera.ts` / `.js` — extract wheel handler into public `onWheel(e)` method
- `render/src/main.ts` — forward `overlayContainer` wheel events to `camera.onWheel()` so zoom works when hovering over text
- `render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — Puppeteer smoke test: spins up the fixture server, loads the page, selects a label via the Selection API, and asserts non-empty text is returned

## Test plan

- [x] Automated smoke test passes: `node render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — 15 selectable elements found, `"root"` selected successfully
- [x] Screenshot confirms blue selection highlight on map label
- [ ] Manual: open the render page, click-drag over a region name or file name to select and copy it
- [ ] Manual: verify camera pan still works by dragging from an empty map area
- [ ] Manual: verify scroll-to-zoom still works when hovering over a text label

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
# cli-rts SessionStart hook
# Ensures capture daemon and render server are running, opens browser tabs,
# then forwards the session-start event payload to the daemon.

SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
CLI_RTS_ROOT="$(dirname "$(dirname "$SCRIPT_DIR")")"  # bin/ -> capture/ -> cli-rts/
CAPTURE_JS="$CLI_RTS_ROOT/capture/dist/cli.js"
RENDER_DIR="$CLI_RTS_ROOT/render"

STARTED=false

# 1. Start capture daemon if not already running on port 4175
if ! lsof -ti:4175 > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  (cd "$CLI_RTS_ROOT" && node "$CAPTURE_JS" start > /dev/null 2>&1) &
  STARTED=true
fi

# 2. Start render server if not already running on port 5175
if ! lsof -ti:5175 > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  (cd "$RENDER_DIR" && npm run dev > /dev/null 2>&1) &
  STARTED=true
fi

# Give freshly-started servers a moment to bind
if [ "$STARTED" = true ]; then
  sleep 2
fi

# 3. Open browser tabs
if command -v open > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  # macOS
  open "http://localhost:5175" 2>/dev/null
  open "http://127.0.0.1:4175/state" 2>/dev/null
elif command -v xdg-open > /dev/null 2>&1; then
  # Linux
  xdg-open "http://localhost:5175" 2>/dev/null
  xdg-open "http://127.0.0.1:4175/state" 2>/dev/null
fi

# 4. Forward the session-start event payload (stdin from hook) to the daemon
node "$CAPTURE_JS" emit session-start

Bash → gh pr create --title "feat(render): make map text selectable" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Region labels and file names in the map overlay now have `pointer-events: auto` and `cursor: text`, making them click-selectable/copyable in the browser
- Camera pan still works from any empty canvas area; zoom (scroll wheel) is preserved by extracting `Camera.onWheel()` and forwarding overlay wheel events to it
- Applied changes to both the `.ts` sources and their pre-compiled `.js` counterparts (Vite resolves explicit `.js` imports to the literal `.js` files at runtime)

## Changes

- `render/src/renderer/MapOverlay.ts` / `.js` — add `pointer-events:auto;cursor:text` to label and file-list elements
- `render/src/core/Camera.ts` / `.js` — extract wheel handler into public `onWheel(e)` method
- `render/src/main.ts` — forward `overlayContainer` wheel events to `camera.onWheel()` so zoom works when hovering over text
- `render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — Puppeteer smoke test: spins up the fixture server, loads the page, selects a label via the Selection API, and asserts non-empty text is returned

## Test plan

- [x] Automated smoke test passes: `node render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — 15 selectable elements found, `"root"` selected successfully
- [x] Screenshot confirms blue selection highlight on map label
- [ ] Manual: open the render page, click-drag over a region name or file name to select and copy it
- [ ] Manual: verify camera pan still works by dragging from an empty map area
- [ ] Manual: verify scroll-to-zoom still works when hovering over a text label

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

data.prompt: great, commit and make a PR

eventLog.message: Commander received orders: "great, commit and make a PR "

Bash → gh pr create --title "feat(render): make map text selectable" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Region labels and file names in the map overlay now have `pointer-events: auto` and `cursor: text`, making them click-selectable/copyable in the browser
- Camera pan still works from any empty canvas area; zoom (scroll wheel) is preserved by extracting `Camera.onWheel()` and forwarding overlay wheel events to it
- Applied changes to both the `.ts` sources and their pre-compiled `.js` counterparts (Vite resolves explicit `.js` imports to the literal `.js` files at runtime)

## Changes

- `render/src/renderer/MapOverlay.ts` / `.js` — add `pointer-events:auto;cursor:text` to label and file-list elements
- `render/src/core/Camera.ts` / `.js` — extract wheel handler into public `onWheel(e)` method
- `render/src/main.ts` — forward `overlayContainer` wheel events to `camera.onWheel()` so zoom works when hovering over text
- `render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — Puppeteer smoke test: spins up the fixture server, loads the page, selects a label via the Selection API, and asserts non-empty text is returned

## Test plan

- [x] Automated smoke test passes: `node render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — 15 selectable elements found, `"root"` selected successfully
- [x] Screenshot confirms blue selection highlight on map label
- [ ] Manual: open the render page, click-drag over a region name or file name to select and copy it
- [ ] Manual: verify camera pan still works by dragging from an empty map area
- [ ] Manual: verify scroll-to-zoom still works when hovering over a text label

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

Bash → gh pr create --title "feat(render): make map text selectable" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Region labels and file names in the map overlay now have `pointer-events: auto` and `cursor: text`, making them click-selectable/copyable in the browser
- Camera pan still works from any empty canvas area; zoom (scroll wheel) is preserved by extracting `Camera.onWheel()` and forwarding overlay wheel events to it
- Applied changes to both the `.ts` sources and their pre-compiled `.js` counterparts (Vite resolves explicit `.js` imports to the literal `.js` files at runtime)

## Changes

- `render/src/renderer/MapOverlay.ts` / `.js` — add `pointer-events:auto;cursor:text` to label and file-list elements
- `render/src/core/Camera.ts` / `.js` — extract wheel handler into public `onWheel(e)` method
- `render/src/main.ts` — forward `overlayContainer` wheel events to `camera.onWheel()` so zoom works when hovering over text
- `render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — Puppeteer smoke test: spins up the fixture server, loads the page, selects a label via the Selection API, and asserts non-empty text is returned

## Test plan

- [x] Automated smoke test passes: `node render/scripts/test-text-selection.js` — 15 selectable elements found, `"root"` selected successfully
- [x] Screenshot confirms blue selection highlight on map label
- [ ] Manual: open the render page, click-drag over a region name or file name to select and copy it
- [ ] Manual: verify camera pan still works by dragging from an empty map area
- [ ] Manual: verify scroll-to-zoom still works when hovering over a text label

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

payload.last_assistant_message:
That's the issue — Vite's dependency cache is stale. Clear it and restart the dev server:

```bash
rm -rf render/node_modules/.vite
npm run dev   # (from the render/ directory)
```

The `setToast` method was added in the latest commit but the cached build of `UnitPool.js` is from before that change. Clearing `.vite` forces Vite to re-bundle everything from source.
